text: Dal colore, oro ambrato con una schiuma bianca, cremosa e compatta. Al palato malto,miele, caramello, frutta fresca, luppolo, luppolo e ancora luppolo. Corpo un pò debole.

Fruity and somehow spicy aroma of cedar and citrus with hints of bread, nuts and caramel: not explosive but really well balanced. Clean golden color with an oversized (if you consider were talking about a best bitter) white long lasting foam. Just the same as the aroma at the palate but with some "woodiness" added. Medium-high carbonation. Medium bitterness. Its surely not an english best bitter as we all are used to know it, Id classify it as a golden ale instead. The 33 cl bottle is definitely too small for this session ale which needs to be drinken in a bigger size: you start loving it only when its over by now.

Ambra velata con schiuma biancastra fine e ampia. Al naso floreale ed erbacea. Carbonazione vivace e corpo medio. Molto piacevole la bevuta con malto e generale dolcezza e una nota luppolata e punta agrumata . Finale breve.

Bottle from the brewery. Pours clear orange with a large, frothy off-white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is toast and biscuit malt with moderate earthy and woody hops. Flavor is moderate earthy and woody hops and bitterness with toast and biscuit malt and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average to large and mostly lasting head. Light to moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light caramel and floral/berry fruitiness, light - some citrus hoppyness. Body is light, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light caramel and light floral/berry fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, faint - light caramel, faint berry fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Watery bitter - finish is bit flat. Nice head and fruity aroma though.

Bottle 33cl. poured into a shaker. Clear medium amber, lot of activity in the glass, tall foamy white to off-white head, half-way lasting, good lacing; citrus nose, aroma pale malts, lemon, grapefruit, biscuit; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, light fruit, dusty; very dry aftertaste, fruity notes, bit woody; medium body,watery to oily texture, soft carbonation; fresh and crisp.
Bottle. Opaque amber color, off-white head. Leathery aroma. Refreshing, fruity flavor. Light body, medium-high carbonation. Nice, lighter ale.

Clear golden color with huge, off-white head. Aroma has earthy hops, tea leaves and even some hay. Taste is really balanced, earthy, hoppy, grassy, just slightly bitter on the finish. Light body with high carbonation. Not really my style of beer. I think its too carbonated for a bitter.

Pale orange-amber body, medium sized off-white head, and soapy lacing. Soft floral and fruity bitterness, clean crackery malts. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and mild bitterness. Semi-dry throughout. Decent euro-pale ale.

Hatalmas, tartós piszkosfehér hab, borostyán szín, szűretlen. Enyhe, citrusos, gyümölcsös illat. Enyhe ízvilág, citrus, déligyümölcsök, jelzés értékű gyanta. Könnyed, közepesen kesernyés, közepesnél kicsit dúsabb szénsav. Jó egyensúly, kellemes, szomjoltó sör.

Samea, kuparinruskea olut kohtalaisella vaalealla vaahdolla. Tuoksu eksoottisen hedemäinen, havuinen, toffeinen. Maku samoin hedelmäinen, ehkä mangoinen, havuinen ja toffeinen. Raikasta juotavaa. Melko kevyt suutuntuma ja runko aavistuksen ohut, mutta todella loistava mieto maitokauppaolut tässä on kyseessä!

0.33 l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki. Aroma has citrus like hops. Looks like amber clear bitter with small head. Taste has pale citrus hops. Also some minerals or herbs which make the palate crisp but not bitter. More like a Session English Pale Ale? Anyway, better than most English bitters.

0.33l bottle. Orange body with a quickly disappearing white head. Classic New Zealand hop character in the aroma with notes of elderflower and bubble gum escorted by grapes and hay. Taste of elderflower, grapeseed, pine and some grains. Quite watery. Not bad at all, its just a bit weak in body and complexity.

A clear dark orange body with a fluffy white head. Nose has notes of menthol, caramel and metal. Taste is also dry with a metallic bitter finish. Carbonation is a bit high for a bitter and the palate is quite light. This is a miss as a bitter, perfectly drinkable beer nonetheless.

330 ml bottle. BB 26/06/2016. (K-Citymarket) Tampere, Finland.
Clear amber color with a small white head. 
Fruity hops, mild bitterness, wood and dry malt in the aroma. Feels stronger. Something very Italian in the aroma. 
The flavor is dryness, mild bitterness, herbal hops, malt and some wood. Not bad.

Bottled 330ml (K-Kamppi)
Hazy amber-orange color, small off-white head. Dry but fruity aroma with light hoppyness. Light-bodied. Dry, orange peels, citrus, mango, even a bit funky. Not really a bitter. Suprised to read that this is top 50 bitter.

0,33l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti. Pours hazy amber with a medium head. Aroma is slightly fruity malts with some yeast. Flavor is creamy malts, some fruits, some yeast and some hops. Pretty decent.

330ml bottle (K Kamppi, Helsinki)
Pale orange, large tight persistent fluffy head. Blandish sweet fruity aroma, more a pale ale than a bitter, if youre having to distinguish the two, slight soapy aspect. Thinnish palate, a bit watery, but an immediate carbonic acid and bittering hop bite. Taste quite yeasty, malts pretty low in comparison - I did pour it clear. Some bitter liquorice root in the finish. A bit dirty. Very naff bitter, not recognisable as a bitter, even. This is surprising, I normally really like Toccalmatto.

330ml bottle served in regular glass. Purchased at Craftissimo - Hong Kong.
A: Pours a cloudy copper red color big and creamy light yellow head with good retention that leaves lots of thin lingering lacings in the glass.
S: Floral nose. Strong notes of herby, grassy and piny hops. Caramel malts and earthy yeasts.
T: Slightly sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of caramel malts and citrus fruits. Notes of grapefruit, pine and resin. Good hops bitterness. Persistent and refreshing hops bitterness.
M: Light to medium body. Average carbonation. Caramel, resin, pine and grapefruit in the aftertaste.
O: Excellent drinkability. Great English Bitter made in an italian way.

330ml bottle from K-Citymarket Sello. Pours copper orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of floral notes, caramel, earthiness, malts, hints of pine. Taste is smooth, floral and malty with some hints of caramel, earthiness and grass. Finish is smooth, fruity and slightly malty with hints of earthiness and floral notes. A nice and smooth malty bitter with an interesting hop profile.

A coppery beer, a head is small bubbled, medium and blond. Aroma has lemon, some flowers and caramel. Taste has flowers, lemon, biscuity maltyness, enough of bitterness, some wood in the end. Almost medium bodied, nicely fluffy palate. Aromatic and enjoyable beer. This brewery knows how to brew.

Cest un truc somme toute assez simple , mais en tout cas je trouve ça très bon. Efficace. ça goûte pas mal lorange amère ... Et le gaz assez fin soutient bien le tout. ABV faible. Le type même de bière qui mirait très bien pour le repas du midi cet été.
33 CL @ bottle. Ottima bitter inglese da Fidenza. Bellaspetto, grande aroma. Amaro deciso. Ottima

0,1l from bottle at Craft Bier Fest Wien shared by me. orange light hazy color, small off-white head. smells pines, creamy, light candy, herbs, light fruity notes. nice smell. light body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes herbs, citric, acidic, some grass. finishes light to medium bitter with grass and citric notes. not overly complex but drinks quite good, good beer.
Golden color with white head. Citrusy hops, pale malt base. Nothing much behind there, but its a bitter. Not complex, but not bad either.
Beerfest Vienna.  Orange golden color with medium white head nice citrus hoppy aroma with caramel Taste, caramel malt followed by nice citrus hops. Good.
At Craft Bier Fest Wien. Quite clean bitter, classic citrusy slightly earthy hoppiness, moderate bitterness. Easy drinking. Very good.

Bue à la pression en 25cl au Pibar à Lausanne.
couleur ambrée, beau col mousseux, peu deffervescence
nez sur la levure
en bouche attaque sur le fer et continuité sur la douceur du houblon.

0,75 bottle shared with cika Boban in Jesolo-Italy. Pours a dark amber color, cloudy with a medium frizzy off-white head. Nose is malty with a US hops feel which is quite distinctive. The carbonation is not that flat (bottle) but the body stays watery and thin as it should be. Not much of the roasted feel which I like in a Bitter and far too much of that citric bitterness which never turns disturbing tough. This is an American Bitter instead.

Long lasting white head, floral, amber, orange, clear, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, short bitter finish

a very good session beer, very good drinkability

In bottiglia da 75cl. Aroma di crosta di pane, caramello, fruttato e terroso. Al palato corpo leggero e scorrevole, carbonazione bassa. Sentori di caramello e crosta di pane iniziali seguiti da una luppolatura ben bilanciata tendente al terroso ed erbaceo con sfumature di fiori di campo. Buona intensità e grande bevibilità
75 cl bottle. Hazy orange with big beige head. Aroma is fruity, hoppy. Bitter hops flavour, long dry bitterness

330 ml from hand pump at Birra+. Dark orange, pretty hazy, with an average, frothy off white head. On the nose floral and tropical fruit hop notes and lots of caramel. Some toffee and roots/herbs as well. Pretty sweet upfront, slightly astringent. Quite herbal and again caramel forward. Ironically not bitter at all. I wouldnt call it watery, but its extremely easy to drink. Soft carbonation, light to medium body, creamy texture. Very nice modern interpretation of the style.

Cobriza, con una espectacular espuma cremosa color hueso con buena retención.
Aroma a frutas tropicales. 
Buen cuerpo, resinosa y con una carbonatación media.
En boca ligeramente amarga y tropical.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroms is caramel, fruity hops, some yeasty notes. Flaovur is biiter yeast, some fruit, quite murky. Meh.

Sampled from bottle @ monthly De Molen tasting. Hazy light reddish color, full sized a bit soapy off-white head. Aroma is lightly malty, lightly butter, lightly hops, slightly fruity. Taste lightly malts, butter, lightly old hops and light to average bitter. Average body and carbonation. Not very good imo.

Bottle at 2nd tuesday tasting @ De Molen, hosted by dEnk. Hazy orange pour, rocky off-white head. Aroma is buttery, fruity, yeasty and slightly spicy. Flavor is buttery, creamy, messy and yeasty. Not too good.

Bottle shared at the De Molen monthly tasting. Pours hazy golden brown with a big bubbly off white head. Aroma of malt, floor, straw and caramel. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

75cl bottle from Grand Central Cellars, Brisbane (expiry 3/6/14). Copper-amber pour with large foamy off-white head that settles to a stable collar. Nose is caramel malts, marmalade, butterscotch and decent flowery hops. Palate is smooth and quaffable with sweet malty flavours up front and a medium floral hop bitterness to the finish. Light-medium body with lightish mouthfeel. Like a decent English Pale Ale.
beverina e rinfrescante, pulita ed equilibrata; amaro non eccessivo, ottima Bitter
Tap at The Grove, Huddersfield. Hazy amber with a thick white head. Aroma is slightly pissy, lots of dried red fruit. Sweet maltiness too. Sweetish finish.
Leafy and a little tinny, but otherwise awesome. Great bitter, flavoursome grapefruit. The flowery hop aroma is wonderful.
on tap at mikkeller and friends. amber with a light haze and thin head; aroma of red berries and caramel with a light chalky touch; medium bitterness, clean and pleasant

On tap. Pours hazy amber with a medium off white head. The aroma is caramel, exotic fruit and citrus. The flavor is bitter hoppy and fruity. Some yeast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear amber small light yellow head. Malty aroma quite dry . Flavir is fruity hopoy flowery citrussy.

Final kente una toccalmatto che mi soddisfa.
Colore ambrato leggermente torbido.
Schiuma presente
Olfatto erbaceo e fruttato agrumi
Palato, luppolo e frutta tropicale.
Nel complesso una birra molto equilibrata e fresca.
Grazie Mirellina
caramel, citrus, amber, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, soft carbonation, A very nice beer.
Keg @ Well & Bucket 2013/5/9 Good body, head retention, carbonation, but the marriage of fruits, berries and caramel on the palate really doesnt do it for me.

Keg at bat. Amber with decent off white head. Aroma of sweat, piss and dirty dish water, like a shit lager with some banana esters. Taste is quite estery, banana, toffee, biscuit, banana toffo sweets. Quite crisp. Number 1 rated bitter at time of drinking. Cant say I dig this. Looks nice....

Keg at the Earl of Essex - London. Pours clear, amber-gold with a fine, creamy white head. Lovely aroma, lots of tropical fruits, papaya, mango, grapefruit, orange. Medium sweet flavor, some caramel candies, plenty more tropical fruits, moderate and balanced citrusy hops, some brown bread. Light to medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Nice hoppy citrus fruits in the finish, more rioe mango, grapefruit, orange. Delicious stuff. Tons of juicy fruits in here.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar, April 2013.

Hazy amber with a small head. Aroma and taste of grass, fruit, bread, caramel and some light notes of spices. Fresh and easy to drink. An ok beer.
Draft. A red beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and berries. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, hops, and berries, leading to a bitter finish. The body is light.

Nice bitter with a hazy gold color, foam is thin and not so persistent. Aroma is hoppy caramel and malty. Body is medium, a little bit watery, in mouth u can notice caramel and citric hops. Nice bitter finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Limpido color ambrato con pannosa schiuma biancastra. Aroma con sentori che si intensificano nel gusto: note di malto, caramello, frutta fresca, luppolo, luppolo e ancora luppolo; lamaro non è eccessivo, ma è dominante, finale un po "corto" ma con una discreta persistenza. Corpo medio-lieve, struttura un po acquosa.
draft at Moeder Lambic, copper caramel pour, big maltiness upfront, decent bitterness. Pretty good for the style

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: pours brown beer with no carbonation and small white head. Smell: spices and hops. Taste: nice hops and spices with malt and sweet taste. Aftertaste : nice malt and bitter complexity.

750ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. My first beer from these guys and it looks pretty good with a loose but large head of foam that reminds me of the foam you see at the beach. Mild copper colour with some caramel, vanilla and malt in the aroma. Thin bodied but not in a bad way, solid flavour and all round this beer stacks up well amongst other bitters.

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg. Cloudy orange/brown beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty fruity aroma, grapes, pears, banana notes, citrus, some peach, bready, spicy notes. Fruity flavor, spicy, bready, grapes, pears, citrus, grassy hops. Fresh and balanced, a nice thirst quencher.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity hoppy grassy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus finish.

Got a 0,75l bottle of this as a birthday present from esp0r, thanks a lot :) Opened and enjoyed january 13th 2012. Hazy orange golden body, huge white foamy head. Aroma is quite hoppy with peach, flowers, orange. Taste of caramel and those same fruity hops, along with yeast notes, acid and pepper. Light body, high carbonation. Finishing with a grassy and dry bitterness.
Draught at Ölrepubliken during the tap takeover, on January 21, 2013.Clody copper to brown color, tan head. Mild, malty, somewhat fruity taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness. Sweet, fruity scent.
Cloudy amber/brown - white head. Dry bitterness, straw notes, light tea/herbal, citrus, ok hoppy, light yeasty, resin, medium malty, light nutty, light cocoa notes

Medium offwhite head. Clear deep reddish brown body with carbonation. Spicy fruity floral aroma with minty notes. Dry menthol and wood taste with earthy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild mouthfeel. Dryish floral menthol aftertaste with fruity wild berry notes. Nice, but low on flavour and character. (0.75l bottle, Meny Oslo City.)

Flaske 0,75l på Vertshuset Skarven, Tromsø. Spandert av Rune før vår årlige juleøltest - i år på 30 Nov. Mørk aprikosfarget. OK skum. God, svakt krydret aroma. Smaken er frisk fruktig. Grapefrukt & annen syrlig frukt. Tørr bitter ettersmak. Forfriskende.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Cloudy amber/brown - white head. Dry bitterness, straw notes, light tea/herbal, citrus, ok hoppy, light yeasty, resin, medium malty, light nutty, light cocoa notes. OK.

Bottle. Pours amber gold with big foamy off white head and creamy lace. Aromas of pine, grass, citrus, a touch of unpleasant yeast, but a nice caramel maltiness. Med light carbonation, Light medium body, a generous bitterness, and a lightly sharp mineral yeSt character. Lingering malt yeast and hop balance. Satisfying and tasty, but the aroma does it the most justice.

Bottled. Pours clear amber color with a medium sized off-white head, leaving a good lacing. Nose of caramel, citrus fruits and straw. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and quite bitter. Medium bodied, watery texture and average CO2. An OK brew, maybe a little overrated. ★★★

750ml bottle shared with friends at Skarven. Pours a huge and dense off-white head, some of it remaining. Spotty lacing. Apricot coloured body. Dusty hops and semi-sweet malts to the nose. Flavoured with lightly spiced fruits and mild honey sweetness promoting a rather succulent taste profile. Fresh fruit bitterness to the finish. Soft in the mouth. Nice (Tromsø, 30.11.2012).

Bottle @ Christers. Pours golden orange with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, flowers, citrus. Flavor is malt, sweet fruity, citrusly hops, grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 041212

Sampled from a 0.75 L bottle.  Tall foamy near-white top. Body is deep gold colored with good clarity. Floral, grassy and light citrus-fruity hop nose. A lightweighter. Slick in the mouth. Light caramel accented malt body. Fruity and floral hop flavor. Gentle bitterness. Short, mildlly fruity-bitter ending. Not very complex,  but very refreshing and certainly great for sessions.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 041212
Bottle, 4.2%. Clear amber/brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hop, citrus and grass. Flavour is malt, caramel, little sweet, little citrus, hop, grass, fruit and medium bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are citrus, fruits, bitter hops, caramel and malt. Nice bitter and actually quite true to the bitter style.

Bottle from Meny Oslo City enjoyed at home
A slow gusher, deep copper hazy, massive tanned head. Takes a long time to pour this one. Smells of tropical fruits, bread, peach, malts, yeast and spices. Moderate sweet, quite alot of peach up front, nice malts, some bread  or biscuits, very drinkable. Medium bitter finish, some citrus zests back there. What an awsome bitter! Very sessionable, balanced, nice hop aromas and malt backbone playing nice together. A very subtile beer where all the ingredients together makes the aroma and flavor

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic St Gilles, Brussels, 19 Oct 2012) Dark amber colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, malty nose with notes of caramel, orange peel and fresh citric hops. Malty, fruity taste with caramel, citrus, orange peel, rye bread and a generous citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Tasty and quite nice.

Bottle, bought @ hop-head.dk. Aroma has nice resiny hops, berries, caramel, light apricot. Medium carbonation, quite dry and creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has soft yeast, some caramel, light chalky, resiny, piney and grassy hops with quite bitter finish.

75cl bottle at Håndverkerstuene. It poured a dark golden colour with a small head. Hoppy and fruity aroma. Dark red fruits. Some malts and sweet caramel. Floral. Flavour is mildly bitter. Grainy. Some fruits and citrus. Short aftertaste

Aroma of  hops and citrus and fruit
The final has a decent bitterness with an average duration.
This is a very good bitter

On 75 cl bottle from Meny Oslo City.
Amber color, lots of foam- gusher light.
Aromas of fruitiness, citrus, malt and distinct but integrated hops
Medium/light body & medium complexity.
Good bitterness, very well balanced 
Very enjoyable session beer

09-NOV-2012, bottle from Magasin, @Ulkløbben meeting @my place.
Hazy orange with lasting tan head.
American pale aleish.
with loads of hops, like grape fruit, and malts like caramel. Thin body.
Really nice brew.

Prima birra bevuta al "Ma che siete.."  di un intenso pomeriggio romano di bevute trasteverine. Spillata a pompa, ambrata, al naso è agrumata mentre In bocca si rivela equilibrata e molto gradevole con un ottimo finale amarognolo.

Bottle @ Mi Orge, Mi Houblon, Belgium. Pours dark ruby copper with a small lasting white head and lacings. Really elegant and balanced beer overall. A bit of marmelade, citrus and bread. Fresh and dry crispy flavor. Lovely!
Ambrata bella schiuma cremosa e persistente, aroma di frutti tropicali cosi anche il sapore in più amro, non invadente che si ritrova anche nel retrogusto insieme a una buona secchezza!

Ambrata allaspetto, leggermente opaca, con una schiuma dalla buona persistenza, cremosa. Al naso si percepisce un bouquet di profumi di frutta tropicale; più in secondo piano sentori di albicocca e di agrumi. Malto appena percepibile con sentori di caramello, lamaro prende piede verso la fine. Il palato rimane secco.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2012  Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, courtesy of Craig, drank in a field or at Frank Cropredy Festival, Friday 10th August 2012  Pours hazy amber with off-white scummy head. Aroma is fruity with a tiny bit of a sour edge. Reasonable bitter but a slightly different malty and yeasty edge, maybe using different yeast and malts. Nice.   A6 A3 T7 P4 Ov13 3.3
bottle  at cropredy 2012 (with calum beerrugbytravels dad)... copper ... big foam head ... soft berry fruit nose ... mellow toffee soft fruit ... juicy malts ... nice ... very nice

Towering fine & dense yellow head, stable over fully hazy darker amber beer. Very fruity hops nose, citrus, succade and preserved ginger; Bit watery-rosewater like, faint perfumey-fruity, but quite subdued. Spritzy, very slight slickness; rather light bodied. Nope. It just doesnt work, the perfumey C-hops for a light British bitter. You get the diluted rosewater solution. A good dose of UK hops, not to forget some crisp and caramelly malts, would have been immensely preferable.

Dark amber, almost toffee colored pour. Fast receding, big-bubbled (juicy double?), off-white head. Little lacing. Fruity aroma mixed with an almost dishwater smell. Bubble gum and cotton candy. Sweet bubble gum flavor with a big estery presence. Juicy Fruit. No hop presence. Bubble gum and esters.

Bottle from Birratrovo, ComoBeautiful amber color; medium sized head. The aroma presents a delicate fruity touch, very nice, and caramel; elegant, wonderful. Lean body, smooth mouthfeel, caramel flavor with light fruity touch; bold bitterness, and a good yeast strain.The aroma is perfect, with some more toffee or biscuit flavor this would be a world class modern Bitter.

Cask at Bir & Fud. Slightly cloudy deep copper. High, fine head. Sweaty hop nose, salty, with some thinner. Dry and hoppy flavor, minerals and light caramel. Earthy, dry, dirty, nice bitterness. Decent, but a bit too dirty for my taste.

17/05/2011 Bir&Fud (tap). Spillata a pompa. Ambrata scura, densa, intensa, abbastanza torbida, con cappello di schiuma bianco sporca, poco persistente. Al naso è agrumata, elegante, morbida, amara decisa ma non eccessiva. In bocca è freschissima, equilibrata, pulita, rinfrescante. Corpo medio, consistenza oleosa, carbonazione soft. Ottima Bitter realizzata con lutilizzo di luppoli americani. Io rimango del partito Inglese.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured gold with a white head and some lace.  aroma was floral and peach tea.  flavor was citrus and slight pine.  body was light and dry with low carbonation.

31/10/2011 75cl bottle @ hotel room, Rome - BB: 5/4/12 (2011-609)
Cloudy red beer, small white head, bit stable, little adhesive. Aroma: very sweet peaches, lychees, some passion fruits. MF: good carbon, medium to light body. Taste: some sweet malts, very fruity, citrus, some exotic fruits, bit dusty, some dried fruits as well, bitter hops. Aftertaste: very dry bitter hops. I wouldnt exactly call this an English bitter, for that the hops are way to American. How about a pale ale, guys?
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, orange in color with fruity hopped aroma, flavor is nutshells and leather with a bitter dry finish

750 ml bottle. A hazy medium to dark amber beer, with an average sized, frothy, lacing, mostly lasting off-white head. The aroma is lightly to moderately malty (caramel, cookies), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, grapefruit), lightly yeasty (dough), with notes of apricot and peach. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, long finish with medium bitterness. Very interesting session beer, fresh, quaffable, with a lot of fruity and hoppy notes. Perhaps only abit light bodied an dwatery, but no major flaws.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a hazy orange body with a medium off-white head.  Aroma of caramel, biscuit, straw, citrus, herbal, and grass.  Flavor of caramel, accentuated minerals (BCAA pills), light citrus, and grass with a dry, moderately bitter finish.
Splendido bouquet al naso, ma al palato perde un po, non mi colpisce, di certo non la miglior bitter del mondo come sbandierato al B&F

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2013 Handpump at Bir & Fud, Rome.
Decent creamy white head.  Slightly hazy amber pour.  Quite a decent bitter.  I was impressed with the handpumps!

Draft at Bir & Fud.  Nice description on this one, which roughly translates to: "Drink it and see if you like it" as far as I can tell.  Gotta love the confidence.  Hazy golden with nice white head and lacing.  Peach and other light fruits, pale malt, and floral hoppy notes on the nose.  The flavor is great and balanced, with a light pale malt base and great floral, fruity, and earthy hop flavors balancing it out.  The bitterness level is spot-on for the style.  Clean and crisp on the palate with a good level of carbonation.  This is a great and very drinkable bitter, coming from an American who barely knows the style, this being my 12th Bitter tick.

Draught at BQ Naviglio Grande.
Clear orange coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity and hoppy aroma of caramel and grass.
Fruity and hoppy flavour of grass and grape fruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

courtesy of Toni Flükiger - dark reddish-orange beer, little foam left; resiney hoppiness, very aromatic; moderate malt body; fair but not overwhelming bitterness; very long herbal and resiney hoppy finish
On tap at BQ, Via Losanna, Milano. Hazy copper colour. Grassy and citrussy hops lead the way, with the bitter flavours balanced by good caramel. Nice.

From tap at Bir & Fud. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and slight citrusy. Crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity, citrusy and crisp fruity flavoured. Bitter and citrusy into a mild fruity and bitter finish.
Amber and cloudy, firm foamy head. Hoppy grapefruit, with cheese and hay aromas. Clear but mild hoppy bitterness from beginning to finish. Wish it had more complexity in the end. (On tap at Bir&Fud)

Colore ambrato con schiuma leggera. Aroma invitante principalmente dagrumi. In bocca è meravigliosamente bitter, equilibrata, pulita, splendida, ancora leggeri agrumi e finale lungo, godibile e amaro.
On tap. Pours a amber with lasting medium white head. Big hop and resin aroma.  Taste is wonderful: hop and resin again, with hints of exotic fruits. Finish is moderately bitter. Great bitter!
Ottima Bitter Ale di color ambrato bevuta alla spina con un amaro intenso e con una gradazione di 4.2%

750mL thanks to Bruno at the brewery! Picture coming soon! The pour is a hazy amber with a huge, sheen, rocky, off-white head. Excellent retention and massive lace. Aroma is Citra hops, bright citrus peel, moves later to toast, rye bread, maple. Taste is bready, toast, roast, caramel, light berries, fruity. Palate is clean, dry, fruity, fresh. Is it the top Bitter in the world? Probably.

Bottle at the brewery, courtesy of Bruno - thank you sir!  Cloudy yellowish gold, nice head with great retention.  Plenty of pine and citrus aroma, nice balanced flavor.  Great bitter with an interesting twist.

On tap. Pours an amber color with a nice creamy head. Good lacing. Nose is spicy, buttery and definitely hoppy. Grapefruit notes. Roasted, earthy with resiny notes. Medium bodied, nice crispiness.  Very refreshing and drinkable!
Bottled. Seems much more like IPA or ESB with active hops in aroma. Starts fruity and flourish with hints of straw, A bit of grain follows with fancy herbal finish and strong hop aftertaste
Alla spina a Rimini, non mi sento di darle un voto più alto perchè non allaltezza delle altre produzioni di questo birrificio, uno dei migliori in Italia

Appena versata è profumatissima al naso, in bocca ha un taglio forse un poco secco; stando nel bicchiere perde rapidamente daroma, ma rimane non spiacevole. Bella bitter però io ora devo lavarmi quindi meglio fare in fretta
In bottiglia @ Domus Birrae. Bitter eccezionale, morbida, abbastanza piatta, correttamente luppolata, beverina e rinfrescante. No Rules!

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium amber color with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, straw, moderate to heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, dusty straw, dry hops, grapefruit. Flavor is light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20110117]

assolutamente non ci siamo.una birra senza corpo ne carattere si sente solo la resina e tutto questo luppolo non è assolutamente supportato da un corpo.una birra dritta e non allatezza di uno dei birrifici piu cari di italia.

Buonissima bitter, bevuta al ma che siete venuti a fa, conm un ottimo corpo e una amaro intenso, nonostante la bassa gradazione alcolica non sfigura affatto nel confronto con la skizoid, anzi ne esce nettamente vincitrice.

dejlig frisk og let drikkelig.
Korn, halm, grape, fyrrenåle, træ, tæt kort skum, lidt sur, bitter, let, vandede, livlig.

Bevuta al Ma che siete venuti a fà e fortemente consigliatami si rivela una delle nuove birre italiane che mi hanno maggiormente stupito questanno. Al naso risulta un po evanescente, ma il sapore è deciso, pieno, corposo e ben equilibrato. Fresca e bevibile.
On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà. Not too much strong, amber, bitter and frothy. One of my best experiences of Toccalmatto Brewery. Very nice. Light carbonation and easy to drink. Very good.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2012 Aroma: citrus, hops, herbs.
Appearance: Deep amber
Taste: not much bitter, fruity, herbs, lemoned, a bit sour.
Palate: mmedium body
Overall: 17/20

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a fa, many thanks to Manuele & Luca. Hazed amber with white head. I understand that this employs Citra hops after the brwe and you can certainly pick up a fruity, sharp grape, lemony bitter note, in fact this is intensely hoppy throughout. The body has substance too, some bread and roastiness. This has to be an eye opener for many British brewers, great stuff.
Buonissima ! con luppoli americani ma beverina complessa e da bere a secchi
Grande bitter atipica con odori agrumari e frutta esotica, al gusto complessa morbida con poca carbonatazione amara e molto beverina
ambrata buona schiuma buona persitenza naso lupopolato leggero caramello molto beverina amaro  deciso
grande bitter atipica con sentori di frutta esotica ma allo stesso tempo beverina ed equilibrata

On cask at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa in Rome.
Pours a dense dark amber with lasting frothy white head. Big hop aroma. Light to medium body. Nice malty flavor topped by mellow hop flavor. Pronounced bitterness but right in style for an IPA. Clean and very well done. actually outstanding job.
